summary: Website storefront for a single shirt priced at $45, using two provided images (front/back) and a Buy Now button that opens a popup modal with Cash App payment instructions; product is labeled as a preorder; add a top-of-page notice that customers will receive updates when the product drops and when their preorder has been shipped (no email shown).
architectural_notes: Payment is manual via Cash App instructions shown in a popup modal; no direct payment integration.
No email sending/collection features; only static text content (do not display the provided email address).
known_issues: Direct Cash App payment integration is not supported; only manual payment instructions can be provided.

existing_features.title: Create a single product page storefront to sell one shirt for $25.
Use the two uploaded images exactly as provided as the product photos (front and back views).

Implement a “Buy Now” interaction that opens a popup modal with manual Cash App payment instructions to send $25 to $bslimeballin and a statement that the product will be sent after payment is received.

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme appropriate for a streetwear product page (avoid default template look), using a consistent color palette, typography, and spacing across the page and modal.
Update the product price from $25 to $45 everywhere it is shown in the UI, including the main product page price display and the Cash App instructions modal amount text.
Label the product as a preorder on the product page, and ensure any purchase call-to-action messaging reflects that it is a preorder (e.g., button label and/or nearby helper text).

Add a notice at the very top of the storefront (visible immediately on first load) with the exact text: “Customers will receive updates when the product drops and when their preorder has been shipped.”

Do not display the email address “sincerelykilla@icloud.com” anywhere in the UI (including header, main content, footer, and the Cash App instructions modal). If the email address exists in any frontend user-facing strings, remove it.
